edu.stanford.math.plex4.io

Class MatlabInterface

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.stanford.math.plex4.io.MatlabInterface

  • public class MatlabInterface
extends java.lang.Object
    This class has static methods for creating Matlab files to visualize data.
    Author:
    Andrew Tausz

      • makeNewMatlabWriter

        public static MatlabWriter makeNewMatlabWriter(java.lang.String label)
                                        throws java.io.IOException
        This function creates and returns a new MatlabWriter.
        Parameters:
        label - a keyword for the filename
        Returns:
        a new MatlabWriter ready to use
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • finalizeMatlabWriter

        public static void finalizeMatlabWriter(MatlabWriter writer)
                                 throws java.io.IOException
        This function cleans up a MatlabWriter when it is no longer in use.
        Parameters:
        writer - the MatlabWriter to clean up
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • exportScatterPlot2D

        public static void exportScatterPlot2D(MatlabWriter writer,
                       cern.colt.matrix.DoubleMatrix2D values,
                       java.lang.String name)
                                throws java.io.IOException
        This function writes the commands to create a scatter plot of the data in the supplied matrix. The matrix is assumed to have two columns, so that each row represents an (x, y) pair.
        Parameters:
        writer - the MatlabWriter to write to
        values - an n x 2 matrix containing the data to plot
        name - the variable name to write to
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • exportScatterPlot3D

        public static void exportScatterPlot3D(MatlabWriter writer,
                       cern.colt.matrix.DoubleMatrix2D values,
                       java.lang.String name)
                                throws java.io.IOException
        This function writes the commands to create a 3-D scatter plot of the data in the supplied matrix. The data is assumed to have three columns, so that each row represents an (x, y, z) triple.
        Parameters:
        writer - the MatlabWriter to write to
        values - an n x 3 matrix containing the data to plot
        name - the variable name to write to
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • exportScatterPlot2D

        public static void exportScatterPlot2D(MatlabWriter writer,
                       cern.colt.matrix.DoubleMatrix2D values,
                       java.lang.String name,
                       int[] labels)
                                throws java.io.IOException
        This function writes the commands to create a scatter plot of the data in the supplied matrix. The matrix is assumed to have two columns, so that each row represents an (x, y) pair. Additionally the points are plotted with different markers and colors for each class.
        Parameters:
        writer - the MatlabWriter to write to
        values - an n x 3 matrix containing the data to plot
        name - the variable name to write to
        labels - the classes for each data point
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • exportScatterPlot3D

        public static void exportScatterPlot3D(MatlabWriter writer,
                       cern.colt.matrix.DoubleMatrix2D values,
                       java.lang.String name,
                       int[] labels)
                                throws java.io.IOException
        This function writes the commands to create a 3-D scatter plot of the data in the supplied matrix. The data is assumed to have three columns, so that each row represents an (x, y, z) triple. Additionally the points are plotted with different markers and colors for each class.
        Parameters:
        writer - the MatlabWriter to write to
        values - an n x 3 matrix containing the data to plot
        name - the variable name to write to
        labels - the classes for each data point
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException
